page.title: 05Doxey Marshes Nature Reserve
page.content: Doxey Marshes is a reserve full of wildlife,most well known as a bird sanctuary.Although there are many other wild animals,Doxey Marshes has over 200 species of birds,so it is more of a bird sanctuary.Many rare birds have visited and some have bred on the Marshes.You can also find the Peacock Butterfly with four conspicuous eye-spots.It emerges in July there are large numbers of Crucian Carp also in the area.Doxey Marshes is also a good place for fishing,they have many fish like Jack Pike and Crucian Carp also fishing in the Marshes is free.Doxey Marshes can be reached by following the footpath along the northern side of the River Sow starting at Doxey Road,near the Broadeye roundabout.
